text: My family and I stayed here for the first time for a week and it was so much more than we even hoped for. The hotel was opened in 2011 and is in amazing condition, apartments were of a very high standard, facilities excellent, staff wonderful and great peaceful location.5 min taxi into the old town/marina (6 Euros) Beach is stunning, 5 min walk.Perfect if you want great quality, short hall flight, lots of English speaking locals and bargain prices.
Lovely resort, lovely people, my second year coming  beautiful place lovely pools food is great entertainment is great for the kids

They had us at the view! We just finished a week here and overall had a great stay. We debated between 4 and a 5 star rating as some of the other reviewers mention there are some things that could be done better. The drinks and food prices were very expensive. Outside of breakfast that was included , we trended to eat or get drinks in town where quality and prices significantly better. Service in the restaurants was just okay and air conditioning in the room did not work well.Despite that there were many great thing about the hotel. The view is better then the pictures. Our family room was a good size and worked well for two adults and two teenagers. The hotel is beautifully decorated. Breakfast was very good with lots of choices. The front desk was very accommodating and helpful. The location is very good and you can walk to the beach or the town in 10 minutes.We would definitely return to this hotel

This hotel is superb for families and adults alike. Food and drink choice excellent. very comfortable beds within large rooms. No complaints whatsoever. Would love to return when i can. Beautiful panoramic views from rooftop bar and if breezy up there you can get a cosy blanket from bar staff.

Just returned from a 6 day break at the Belmar Spa and Beach resort.Very nice, spacious 2 bed apartment. Everything worked and we were very comfortable.Location is key with the Belmar, it's right on a nice beach but walkable (20 mins) into Lagos town, which at night is vibrant and atmospheric.Why not 5 stars?1. Room was cleaned only once in 6 days.2. Although we were aware that check-in was from 4pm we knew we would arrive early and we phoned to see if we could check-in a little earlier. Although they sounded very positive on the phone about accommodating our request when it came to it they couldn't, which left us in limbo for a couple of hours.3.  We come to the Algarve every year and stay somewhere different. At ¬£1100 (room only) for 6 nights, this is more than double the amount we have ever paid for accommodation, therefore expectations were high. I left feeling the Belmar was over-priced compared to other experiences we have had on the Algarve. However, we've never been so close to the beach before, so I guess the location comes at a premium.Ultimately, I can recommend the Belmar.

Belmar Spa & Beach Resort is beautiful. It‚Äôs wonderful location on the cliff top of Porto de M√≥s Beach is perfect and if you have a room with a view you can enjoy great sunsets. The rooms are big and in pristine conditions. Food is great, mainly breakfast, which has lot of variety and great quality in everything. We had dinner once and it was also quite good. Parking is available which is great, especially if you go during summer time. We are definitely returning to Belmar!

This beautiful hotel does so many things well. But it‚Äôs the little things that can hurt the experience. The Wi-Fi in the rooms is so bad it‚Äôs almost useless: 12mbs. We had no washcloths in the bath - probably just an oversight and not a big deal, but still annoying. The lack of outlets is inexcusable. There are no accessible outlets near the bed. We had to charge electronics in the bathroom and on the floor across from the bed. Really? The bathroom is laid out so that the soap dispenser is on the opposite side of the counter from the sink. It‚Äôs 2 steps to get soap and 2 steps back to the faucet. First time I‚Äôve seen that.The breakfast buffet is outstanding and service is very good as long as you don‚Äôt need a refill on coffee.  The sky bar is beautiful but I had the worst martini ever there.I don‚Äôt know if it was cheap gin, watered down gin, or no gin, but it wasn‚Äôt drinkable.In all, this is a beautiful hotel. If only they could fix the little annoyances‚Ä¶

I am not entirely sure what I expected, this is a quirky place perhaps more style than substance.  Don't get me wrong, there is nothing bad here, it is just that there is nothing great either.  We went for the top end room, a sea view suite and it is lovely.  The suite comes with free spa access - otherwise 20 euro per person per day.  The enormous bath that overlooks the sea is also great fun.That said the room level design is ill conceived and owes more to pretentiousness than utility.  Storage is poor, the provision of sockets is poor (the kettle is plugged in on the floor by the door), the glass doors are just silly, the glass doors on the bathroom offer no privacy, are noisy and irksome. The bed head/utility centre is not fixed, the shower screen is only 50% rather than the industry standard 70% and so water gets all over the floor.  There are too many lights and light switches and the automatic light under the bed is really annoying at 3am when the other half tries to slip away for a quiet bathroom visit (the doors are especially annoying then too).Breakfast is ok but in 6 days we have only be greeted once.  Sorry but, meet, greet and seat with coffee served at the table is a minimum for 4 stars in my world.The spa again is over thought out and therefore misses its own point.  The pool is too cold, the jacuzzi too chlorinated and we have no idea what the relaxation room and salt room are about..... We are regular spa users and even so we're bemused by it.  I am a gym nut and this is one of the better every day hotel gyms I have seen anywhere in the world, so quite happy there.That said we kind of like the place, most of the staff and the hotel in general are trying to make a poor concept work.  The lynch pin is a chap called Jose (Joe) an engaging local who has nevertheless seen the world and knows how to talk to people.The transfers to Funchal for the day are great but a little prices and if, like me you are easily bored, you will need to find things to do as Calheta has little to offer.  On the other hand my wife loves not having much to do so if you are a contented pool lounger, then this is ideal for you.

I don't routine review hotels on tripadvisor, unless, for good or bad, they are exceptional. The 1908 Lisboa definitely falls into the good category. I wasn't sure what to expect at this hotel as it wasn't our first choice, but I'm very glad it was our second. From the moment we arrived, we were made to feel welcome. Reception is a small desk between the bar and the restaurant but service is in no way compromised. Receptionis Malfada(?) got us a drink and linked us up on whatsapp so she could help us with sightseeing and other queries. A mid evening arrival and our luggage is whisked up to our room while we are shown into the restaurant for dinner. Rooms and bathrooms  are of a good standard, but some drawers for storage wd be good. Reception and serving staff are all friendly and helpful - with only the odd exception (the trouble with high standards is that the odd minor exception stands out!) The hotel is well located in a pretty square with an outside seated area for drinks and two other restaurants opposite for variety. Hotel decor is stylish and quirky. It boasts a young, fashionable clientele but we didn't feel excluded! Dinner was good, breakfast fab with lots of options, fresh fruit etc.All in all, I would'nt hesitate to recommend the 1908 Lisboa.  (The so called five star hotel where we are currently staying could definitely learn a thing or two from the management at the 1908).

Stayed here for 5 days in a one bedroom apartment in March self catering. It was very quiet but everything still ran as normal eg, shuttle bus to old town was on everyday. The apartment was massive, we hardly used the living room but the kitchen was useful with full appliances in and utilities. The maids brought fresh towels every day for us however we made the beds each day, despite this the room was always kept immaculately clean. On arrival the reception staff were very friendly, gave us plenty of information about our stay and they also ordered taxis for us during our stay (which was a cheap company too!) We also used the spa on one afternoon due to bad weather, which was very relaxing with access to the indoor pool, jacuzzi, sauna and Turkish bath however the only downfall is you have to have a swim cap for the pool which they charge ‚Ç¨2.50 for each and after this the pool was actually very very cold. As we were self catering we didn't use either the restaurant or the bar as we went to the old town every night, but we did use the games room a few times for pool which cost us quite a few euros as there is only 1 out of the 3 pool tables which has a white ball! Other than those few little niggles, we really enjoyed our stay and it definitely deserves the rating it has.

Excellent hotel in comfort, excellent professionals very clean and caring.It is 30 minutes from the center, with child out area inside, upper terrace and very appropriate for rest.Best place for breakfast and dinner.I recommend it.

Of the best accommodations we have ever been in Portugal! Everything excellent, from the rooms, to the cleanliness, extreme sympathy of the staff, a fantastic breakfast and to cry for more, the owners of the house, Lu√≠s and Catarina, to whom we already thank the hospitality, are extremely helpful and leave us very at ease. The pool is wonderful and allows for good moments in family. In short, we loved and left here with the desire to return quickly. Muto thanks üôè

horrible experience even before we got here we had trouble checking into the room. Me and my friend were staying for a tennis tournament and they wouldn‚Äôt let us Into our room and would not refund us. They then decided they would let us in. that day we ordered room service and you couldn‚Äôt add your room service to the room which was a joke. I then asked to pay in card but they were only accepting cash. The hotel manager called me 3 times and was very rude to me about the situation. The wifi was terrible I could not access anything for the money I paid it was a joke. Terrible place don‚Äôt come here it‚Äôs awful. So many better hotel around here for less money.

After months of lockdown we treated ourselves for a birthday the last weekend at Estalagem Ponta do Sol.Living on the island for the last 10 years we always go away to Funchal (from Calheta) but this time decided to go to Estalagem as we've heard so many good stories from friends who had stayed there while visiting us, as well as always highly spoken off by our local friends.First of all, the location is excellent, views to the west and south coast from the hotel is breathtaking. A beautiful pool with infinity corner effect from where you can admire the views. The indoor pool is a great addition for colder days but as we were there in the middle of summer, obviously no need for that. Plenty of cozy corners all over the property where you can find the perfect spot to sunbath while admiring the views. Access is made much easier with the lifts that connect all the different levels. Although we did prefer to walk mostly between the levels as the gardens are so beautiful. From the hotel it is a short walk to the beach below and the picturesque town of Ponta do Sol with its alleyways and cozy bars / restaurants.Our room was on the 3 level facing west. Not advertised as a sea view room, but we had 50% sea view and 50% mountain view, to be honest a much prettier picture also at night with the street lights from the town below. At day the mountains / valleys keep changing with the shades as the sun is moving. We could clearly see the amount of thought put in to make it a safe stay referring COVID-19. The chairs all had removable covers that can be washed after each stay. Rooms are decorated minimalistic which make it easier to disinfect. Bathrobes etc all in packaging, as is the cups etc. Our room was spotless and definitely not dated. I did find it useful to have USB sockets built in. Much easier for charging the phone next to the bed. The balcony was spacious too but we did not make much use of it during our stay.Staff were throughout our stay friendly, helpful  and accessible. Keep in mind, with the current pandemic their workload has probably doubled if not more. We could see them constantly disinfect every table, surface etc.  We did not have dinner at the hotel but did go back each evening for a drink to admire the view and lights. Breakfast was served at our table from a small menu, which I actually prefer to a buffet. It was more than sufficient and no problem to ask for seconds. Interesting the amount of staff during the breakfast hours to make sure all guests were served quickly and efficient and at the same time disinfecting the tables for the newly arriving guests.All in all it was one of our most memorable stays on the island. I just can't believe that we only  get around to visit it after 10 years here but we will definitely soon go back for a weekend break!

This is a fairly small hotel but exceptionally user friendly. All of the staff, without exception, were extremely polite, helpful and courteous. The hotel was spotless, the food was good and very reasonably priced. I look forward to my next visit and would recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Every staff member was friendly and helpful with anything I needed - making change, booking my day trips, lending me an iron, etc. The location is very central and just a 15-20 minute walk to the other hostel by the beach with the pool.

This place is wonderful. It has character, surf charm, a homely feel , and is also totally clean, exceptionally well run, and warmly hospitable.I thoroughly enjoyed my stay, only wish I could of stayed longer.Surf lessons were super professional but chilled!Every morning started out with an awesome breakfast ( always a savory and sweet cooked option at breakfast)Location was great- walking distance to the beach or town centre and a few meters from the nearest shop.Staff were always helpful and cheerful.Highlight might still have been the hostel pug and her added cuteness but big shout out to the whole algarve surf hostel crew!

I stayed here while visiting Lisbon and was quite happy with the accommodation, attentive staff and exceptionally comfortable beds. In a high end shopping district, close to town center & Lisbon attractions, I would recommend this hotel for any discerning traveler.

The Marriott Lisbon is located about 20 minutes from the airport and is about 5 minutes away from downtown and the edge of the city center. The hotel lobby is standard for a Marriott inclusive of a gift shop, concierge lounge, and bar. The ground floor has a restaurant, fitness center, outdoor pool and conference rooms. The standard guest rooms and suites are satisfactory, but are dated and in need of modernizing. The plumbing is old and each morning I had to run water for about 5 minutes to open up the lines to rid the foul air emoting from the plumbing. I notified maintenance and they responded to my requests. As a Lifetime Titanium with Marriott I was attempting to use my suite night awards for my stay. There seemed to be quite a bit of misunderstandings between Marriott reservations who booked my room, and the Lisbon staff who somehow between the two did not attach/receive my suite night awards and somehow mixed up my arrival date. The staff onsite accommodated all of my requests to include an upgrade to a suite. Jessica (front desk staff and trainee) did an amazing job with helping me sort through my arrival process and went above and beyond to ensure I had a wonderful stay. I had one mishap, me and 2 of my friends were stuck in the elevator for an hour (not fun while on holiday) but was glad to have a glass of champagne on hand to pass the time away while stuck inside! Paula Coehlo, manager onsite greeted me afterwards and apologized for the mishap and provided a wonderful chocolate and wine tray for me and my friends for the unplanned incident. Thank you! The lounge staff were also super accommodating. Susanna, the evening staff shared ‚Äúmust-do‚Äù activities including local foods to try and the nightlife scene. She was awesome!!!  All trips tend to have an element of surprise, or unexpected event and this was certainly true for this stay, but the Lisbon team met  and even exceeded my expectations and made this trip a joyful one...Obrigado Marriott Lisbon Team!!!

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & Ch√¢teaux
text: Excellent choice!!! Very friendly, supportive and attentive to each and any details stuff (which made a difference). Wonderful restaurant and Great location. It's in a walking distance from Alfama and Baixa.

Lisbon and the Independente combined to give us a wonderful experience, each and every day of our stay. We had fallen in love with Lisbon the previous year but this time around, the Suites took us to another level. If you want to stay somewhere that has character, style and individuality this is a must. Forget the modern chain, corporate hotels and book in here to enjoy being looked after as a valued visitor to this amazing city. A warm colourful reception area is only matched by the warm friendly welcome from the girls at reception on arrival.The building is Art Deco in style and has been creatively enhanced with restaurants and a bar, which add to the relaxed ambience and atmosphere. Breakfast is served on the terrace and has magnificent views looking over the city and the Tagus. What better start to your day, siting outside in the sun, planning the places to visit, eating a wonderful breakfast and being entertained by the joyful Mamma?The rooms and bathroom are always clean and fresh when you return later in the day. The rooms at the front of the building have stunning views overlooking the park and the city beyond. There is no noise issue even though the road is usually busy with traffic.The central location is perfect for walks to all that this amazing city has to offer. The local area has a good number of interesting, quirky bars and restaurants, allowing you a short walk back to the Independente after an enjoyable evening.We had a wonderful time and we would like to say thanks to all the staff for adding to our wonderful experience in Lisbon. Even the theft of a passport did not dampen our spirits and again a thank you to the Independente for your genuine concerns and in arranging to keep our room for an extra two nights.Hope to see you in the future.Graham and Joyce.

I stayed at this hostel for 6 nights and from the beginning it didn't feel like a hostel. It felt like I was over a friend's place with a bunch of people that I didn't know and we were all having a blast. Doing BBQs, having drinks by the pool and going out with the staff and guests for dinner in the city center. I came for the surf but the stay at the hostel was already worth it on its own. I left already making plans to return.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: An old-school RmDream Hotel. Great location, wonderful view, nice pool, great breakfast! We were there for the second time.

This is one great hotel,the staff make it even better,from the guys on the door to the staff in the breakfast room.must mention Adrianne customer relations girl,she smiled all day and was a good sight to see if you needed anything.The breakfast was excellent set you up for a days sightseeing.Room I had was just as good as any I've had,the linen and towels matched the hotels excellence, and the bed well wish I had at home.This is definitely one to watch as it's quite new but will be amongst the top boutique hotels in Lisbon.Looking forward to returning.

Staff were very friendly and exceeded expectation throughout my week stay.  The fitness center is very nice and open 24 hours.  We had mainly catered food for our meeting at the hotel and it was excellent.  I like the location near the river for morning runs and evening meals.  The hotel is new and most rooms have balconies.  I would definitely stay here again.

We've stayed in a few 5 star hotels and this was overall the best. Food - we only eat breakfast but always plentiful, good selection and good quality. Room - we booked one with a sea view and we were so glad we did. Just listening to and watching the ocean whilst reading a book or napping was great. Nearby - a few decent restaurants in Calheta to choose from and we went to Estalagem hotel in Ponta da Sol; can highly recommend. Also look out Zion Project for an amazing beach bar with music experience. Only down point was the open plan bathroom in the room which meant you 'really' got to know your partner. Not a bad thing really but sometimes a bit of privacy is nice. Not enough to take a star off.Finally, like to call out the last guy who wrote a terrible review - don't be such a wuss and man up in the pool. It's fine once in. And as for getting charged ‚Ç¨10 per room service visit - walk to the supermarket like the rest of us and buy a bottle of coke instead of getting someone to deliver individual cans to your room! And it clearly says on the room service menu that there is a ‚Ç¨10 charge per visit! *shakes head*

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: The hotel is magnificently situated on a private headland. From the moment we arrived the staff were so courteous and made us feel so comfortable. Our room had magnificent views a photograph of which now serves as my screensaver at work. The breakfasts are remarkable but are best taken early so you can dine at a table with a view. Nothing is too much trouble.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: Enjoyed a fantastic holiday in Madeira and Belmond Reid's Palace was a wonderful place to stay. Everything was perfect for us.We enjoyed all our meals there - William Restaurant and Villa Cipriani.  We also had an Afternoon Tea which was delicious.Very helpful and friendly staff, and the most lovely ladies looking after our room.We wouldn't hesitate in returning in the near future.

hotel_name: Hotel Covilha Dona Maria Affiliated by Meli√°
text: Traveling as a 21 year old student, I spent 2 nights in this hotel, which was a very good choice with an affordable price, very good quality of services and a good location close to Serra da Estrela.The room and the hotel in general were clean, breakfast offers a wide choice of food and drink and the staff was very professional and patient, especially considering my low level of Portuguese.The pool was clean, heated and large enough, and the gym is well equipped, for both beginners and experienced practitioners, with a staff attentive to your exercises to avoid injuries during your workout üí™üèª.Obviously, I recommend this hotel to everyone and for any type of stay, and especially for long stays (2 days and more), so that we have time to enjoy all the hotel services like swimming pool, gym, spa, etc.Personal rating to the front desk and bar teams: thank you so much for your patience and kindness, it was the first time I travelled alone in Portugal, and your patience with my low level of Portuguese made me feel more comfortable here üôèüèªüòá. I will conclude this comment with the following: \Muito obrigado a todos para sua paci√™ncia!\""

We returned to this hotel for the 2nd time, the bar is under renovation, the reception without warmth, the room service needs to be improved, there is always something missing and you have to ask at reception. The catering is still good.

It has small rooms with a small bed. The fixtures are modern and the shower is good. It is a 20 minute walk to the Rossio area that has many restaurants. It is close to the metro and also the sight seeing tour buses stops. Staff are nice, the breakfast is plentiful but quality is poor enough in terms of hot foods. Decent choice if you are on a bit of a budget. Can walk to the sea from there also. If you like to shop there are many designer shops close to the hotel.

Simple hotel with good beds and nice staff. Breakfast is from 6.30 to 12! So for the late risers. The quality of the breakfast matches the accommodation and is simply fine. Price/quality very good. Not much to do in the area. A restaurant, bar, supermarket and snack bar within 200 meters.

hotel_name: Hotel Covilha Dona Maria Affiliated by Meli√°
text: Perfect quality and price.  The hotel is very good. Large pool, full gym, large and free parking. Very good gastronomic offer. Spacious and clean rooms. The staff very attentive and loving.. hotel that is designed for family. We'll be back for sure.

Overall an excellent experience. Calheta is not the greatest location in Madeira (very quiet) but you‚Äòre only a short car ride away from Funchal. The Hotel is amazong, lots of hotels, pools, bars and the staff is really helpful and friendly

hotel_name: Hotel Covilha Dona Maria Affiliated by Meli√°
text: Had a 5 day vacation with my wife and 2 month old child. Overall we had a nice time at the hotel. The room was suppose to be noiseless but it wasn't, probably wouldn't notice it if not for the feeding schedule of our little baby. Didn't really found out the cause/source of the noise, but did talk about it with the front desk, and they where as helpful as could be considering I couldn't pinpoint  what was causing the noise or where exactly it was coming from.If you like to workout during your vacation, I can honestly say this was the hotel with the best gym I have ever found. It's quit nice and let's you do a very reasonable workout .One thing I didn't like, and found to be very poor was the wifi service provided by the hotel. I was in the 4th floor and had next to none Internet access. The signal was very poor, and most of the time nonexistent. Once again talked to the front desk, and promptly they tried to get it to work a bit better but with no luck to me.The staff was most helpful. Overall, very nice stay.

Lovely hotel in a fantastic position. On arriving we had no idea on how beautiful the area and friendly the people are. Perfect for a beach or walking or both. Plenty of restaurants serving the local cuisine. We particularly liked A Gale and Taste.

A fantastic hotel. The view from our room included the Atlantic ocean and steep mountainsides with waterfalls. Perfect breakfast, very friendly staff and personal service. Easy to get to walkpaths in the surroundings. We rented a scooter for longer trips.

Was a bit sceptical before travelling as some reviews are not great but I was pleasantly surprised! Travelled with friends but I would also defiantly come here as a couple or family. It really does suit everyone! It is great if you are looking for self catering in a good location but not right in the heart of the hustle and bustle. It is a 10 minute walk to both the beach and the main strip area of Albufeira. There is a supermarket 2 min walk from the hotel with a few restaurants and bars here as well. We ate at a couple of restaurants located close to the hotel and they were really good! Prob better than most of them on the strip.Apartments are clean and comfortable, quite basic but you are self catering at the end of the day what more do you want or need? You can get wifi for about √¢‚Äö¬¨5 per day for use in your room and around the pool/lobby area.Was reasonably priced bar and lunch/snack menu at the property.Staff were always very helpful and nothing was ever too much trouble, always happy to help with a smile.Pool area was great, lovely large pool so it was not cramped. It was also good as separate kids pool meant you didn't have to be right on top of kids playing if you didn't want to.Just one thing to bear in mind....when we arrived we had to pay √¢‚Äö¬¨100 euro deposit for any damages, which was not a problem but if you are not expecting it, then it may leave you short.Overall perfect location, clean and friendly.

Pros and cons of this resort:Pros: it is more relaxing than the hustle and bustle of downtown Ponta Delgada. The breakfast buffet is included and great selection, the bartender pours generously and makes great drinks, the food at the restaurant tastes good for the most part. I had local azorean white fish which was delicious. the pool is very convenient and clean, there are walking paths nearby. There are beautiful views and good ambiance.Cons: if you do stay here, we would recommend a car. Also, don‚Äôt plan on being able to get into your room a minute before your check in time. We arrived so exhausted and there was no wiggle room on our check in time. They do allow you to use the facilities though. Front desk staff are somewhat rude and they don‚Äôt have any basic items like ibuprofen. The bathroom is see through. If you‚Äôre comfortable with seeing each other go to the bathroom it‚Äôs not a big deal but there is zero privacy. The restaurant and accommodations made by the staff overall seem to be the worst parts. We were hungry by 5:30 and they told us dinner starts at 6:30. So we walked around and came back at 7. There were maybe 10 tables open yet they told us we need a reservation. So we made one for 8. We think there might not have been enough servers. They really try to squeeze money out of you. The bread which we didn‚Äôt want was extra. The water had to be bought- no option for tap water ( but the bar will give you tap water. ) if you order meat get it more well done. Medium rare is cold. They really try to go over the top with presentation but neglect the basics such as food preparation. Some servers are rude and the manager runs around like a chicken with his head cut off. One night there was a wedding and we were informed the restaurant would be closed for dinner but they were serving a buffet for hotel guests. We found out later that we needed to make reservations. We were able to sneak in and realized there were tons of tables open and so much food, which made he whole thing seem absolutely ridiculous. The hotel does a poor job accommodating for guests. So many times I wanted to say, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm staying here, do you know that?!‚Äù It would really be in their benefit to also have a shuttle with more transports.Overall it would be in anyone‚Äôs best interest to stay somewhere else. There are other resorts nearby with comparable prices that are probably much better.

Location/view very nice! We had a room with a side sea view on the fifth floor (see photo). In retrospect, we were very happy with this choice due to its quiet location and direct view of the side garden, beach, cliffs and sea. Rooms with direct sea view overlooked the pool and sea.Very quiet around the hotel. I think it could have been a bit more lively. Boulevard Armacao can be reached within 35-40 minutes via a beautiful cliff walk. There is a cozy and friendly atmosphere on boulevard Armacao.You will be taken via Uber for about ‚Ç¨5 (bus transport also possible, but not tried)Sufficient sunbeds available at the pool, but many beds need to be replaced.Extra bed in room is not comfortable. Requested an extra mattress after first night. This was also neatly arranged. Regular beds too hard in our opinion.Reception staff friendly and helpful. Cleaning and service staff were very timid and seemed submissive to us. Even with a friendly greeting, they make virtually no eye contact.Breakfast something for everyone, but standard and no variety. Bread (dry) and coffee (weak) not to our taste.Lunch in an outdoor bar: cost/quality disproportionate. Outside of this, an additional 10% service charge will be charged without request. We recommend lunch outside the hotel. Didn't try dinner in hotel.There is a quiet, friendly atmosphere in the hotel, even in high season. If you like entertainment, the hotel is less suitable.We rented a car. Read a lot about insufficient parking. This is also correct directly in front of the hotel. However, you can always find a spot within a few minutes' walk (in the middle of high season).In general, the hotel could use a makeover. In terms of cleaning, everything is (reasonably) kept up to date

Enjoyed a few days here recently. Staff were friendly and went out of there way to make stay and celebrations a good one. Breakfast had a very nice variety available. Rooms were large, with nespresso machine. Just be aware there is a little step in the shower.

Rooms are only okay very basic!!!Bathrooms are ridiculously small. If there is anyone in your group a bit larger than average avoid. Always arguments from other residents every night. No security that we could see.The surroundings were beautiful but every day not enough sun beds to accommodate the large complex. Not one day out of the four we stayed could we avail of sunbedsWe went to the bar and although we were NOT all inclusive and WERE PAYING customers you could only order one kebab at the snack bar at a time. After queuing in the large queue to order this we were then told we had to pay at the drinks counter!!! This should be clearly marked as it wastes a lot of time. Also for PAYING customers the option to buy a number kebabs if you want should be allowed.(without the ignorance of the men working behind the counter) All our group had to que separately rather than been allowed purchase some for our friends.The room from the reception is literally a trek and a half. Would not stay here again

This is a nice hotel.. 5* as its advertisement. Clean and friendly staff...We booked the suite...We did however feel that if you state 24 hour room service. .your call shouldn't be moved to voice mail.Also..the bar is empty in your room! Which is not a good thing. (No water etc) no kettle..but a coffee machine without the coffee!Its definitely for family ..good breakfast...but no food in bar after midnight and you cannot take your drinks up to your room... (health and safety)

We have enjoyed a lot our stay in Natura Algarve Club. We had everything we need in the accommodation and enjoyed a lot the outside area with the swimming pool. The staff are very polite. There was a regular change of towels and the cleaning lady Monica was very nice!We would definitely come back to this lovely place!

We stayed at Altis (for the second time!) in September 2019. We just wanted to say thank you to the warm and helpful staff for assisting with our pre-wedding preparations  (in particular for the help with all of our luggage).We loved relaxing in our room with an excellent view of the marina, at the rooftop pool and in the spa (including having a fantastic massage). We also hosted our pre-wedding drinks in Cafetaria Mensagem. Bruno and the waiting staff were very helpful both beforehand and on the night, and our guests commented on the lovely views and the friendly service. Finally, we went to Feitoria during our previous stay and it was excellent.Thanks again. Hopefully we will be back.

Nice hotel, clean and helpful staff. only thing I didn't like about our room was the bedroom was up stairs. Air con didn't work. Only 2 minute walk to the strip. not much happening at the hotel though, pool is nice but bar snacks are poor only toasties and some sort of breakfast plate on offer... Grand spot if your there for a lively week in the new town, nothing else though ...

Beautiful surroundings with a staff that goes out of their way to ensure your great time.  They serve a delicious breakfast with local foods and beverages. The staff assisted us with obtaining tickets to a Fado performance, recommended several restaurants near the venue and made sure we knew how to order an Uber.

Great hotel ,good location, good food, good staff,good amenities,good pool,its only 25 minutes from Faro airport ,direct route along the A25,they have great underground parking directly under the hotel at. Moderate cost

A good point about this hotel was the room.The food is nothing to write home about, but if you like plastic scrambled egg and cheap sausages for breakfast and stews made up off left overs for dinner you will be OK.We paid for all inclusive but only one bar in the hotel that served drinks without charge,the other bars charged and were not cheap!The staff did not seem happy in their work, the first smile I got was when they asked if I enjoyed my stay at checkout.My reason for writing this review is to worn other family's that the inclusive package is not up to much and could end up costing you more than you think.

The hotel was ideal for us. Location is by the river so the view is always interesting and changing, with activity on the bridges and on the water. It is five minutes' walk from the Ribeiro, where there are a lot of bars and restaurants, buskers, street market, boat trips etc, and also the funicular which takes you up to the top of the cliff where the railway station and the main shopping centre are (2.50 euros per trip; it avoids a hefty flight of steps). The hotel was smart and clean, staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast is a wonderfully leisurely affair, if you want it to be, served buffet-style from 7am to 11am which suited us fine because one thing we don't appreciate about hotel stays these days is being chased out of breakfast early. There was always plenty of variety on the buffet. One thing to be aware of is that the hotel does not do lunch or dinner, except as an order from the room service menu (pizza, burger, crusty sandwiches) which you can eat in the bar area. The bar closes at 11pm, which will be a bit early for some but didn't bother us, specially with plenty of alternatives nearby.  The hotel's best-kept secret is the roof terrace, accessible by the lift (press 'C') which is a wonderful spot to relax and enjoy the sun, along with views of the Douro.

Room was spacious, well lit and clean. It was near a mini grocery store and a walking distance to the metro/bus stop. I was also very fortunate to meet one of the neighbour who was very kind and helpful. Catarina, the host, was also very nice! They have an option for airport transfer that was very convenient for me since I had to leave by 4am. It was a lovely stay for me in Porto.

hotel_name: Porto Pal√É¬°cio Hotel by The Editory
text: Excellent quality hotel, with very professional staff, spacious rooms and spa with no restrictions for age visits (good for children). I don't know if it was about Portugal, but everywhere we went the service was absolutely excellent, friendly and people genuinely paid attention and always try to help.The terrace on the 19th floor had a great view and service, but there were no cushions on the couches or umbrella's for some shade. I know it was early season, as we visited in May, but still you expect that the facilities will be fully prepared for the guests to enjoy.The breakfast buffet was somewhat poor without any raw vegetables and boring choice of sliced fruit. You cannot really enjoy more than once or twice.This seems to be the hotel of choice for all airlines stopping at Porto, so breakfasts were quite busy. Generally I did not like the taste of water and coffee. I do think Nespresso machines should be a standard kit for any self respectable hotel these days.The bed, bathroom and rooms in general were very good quality and well designed and equipped. The WIFI is 10 euro per 24 hours, but speed is really good and I could stream movies without a problem.The taxis are readily available and the only surprise is that most drivers are well passed retirement age, but some drive as on a race all the time.I fell in love with the cutlery of the hotel and bought a 130 pcs set myself from now my most favourite Portuguese brand Cutipol.I know Portuguese food is excellent, but we found one of the best Japanese restaurants in Europe, I am sure (!) called Ichiban (you need to book it in the evening or there will be no space).Nice holiday! Portugal is a great holiday destination! Would absolutely recommend!

Pestana Viking is no doubt a very good resort, mainly because of what it got to offer to residents.... Pros n Cons would sum it up but definitely a recommend !!!!We were a group of 12 and had an amazing time üëçüèºPros:-Safe, Well maintained and clean rooms, pools, sauna, jacuzzi (all free to residents)-Smiley and friendly staff all through the hotel, and do not interfere in what you do. Very peaceful and helpful.-Amazing location and just near the beach, also a good 15 min walk to InterMarche( local supermarket)- Not overly touristy, so you get your own space.Cons:-In-room amenities could be improved :AC coolness (was not enough to beat the heat), toiletries were bare minimum(toothpaste, moisturiser, hand wash, were all not included), NO complimentary tea/coffee/water in rooms.-The Sea Facing rooms (310, 312, 414) were a BIG disappointment.... Especially at higher rates.- The food can use some spice in it!- The Table Tennis rackets were pathetic ‚òπÔ∏è

This was our second visit in one year to magic and magnetic Marv√£o and we stayed again at Albergaria el Rei Dom Manuel. The place has kept the level in every aspect. We had a good reception by the owners(that we hadn't met last year), and actually one employee -Maria- recognized me instantely. This small hotel is very clean, well kept in its relatively simplicity, and breakfast is as good as I described last year. They have honest food for lunch and dinner, but I've heard there is another good place to eat which we will try in our next visit!

The level of service was excellent! They made us feel like King and Queen! Special thanks To the front desk staff for their kindness and positive atmosphere! Also the upstairs spa area was truly relaxing! Absolutely a true five star hotel!

We stayed for a week at this hotel. Our room was great. We had a lovely little balcony overlooking the garden. The fridge was a real asset. Everything was spotlessly clean and the linen and towels were changed regularly. The continental breakfast was excellent, with a vast range of items to choose from. All the staff were friendly and helpful. It's about a 10 minute walk from the seafront, and a similar time to walk into the town.

Great Hotel. The breakfast was very good and had a lot of variety of options. The location was nice and convenient above 1 of the city's metro stations. It was very easy to get between the airport and this hotel by metro and only took about 20 minutes. It was another 20 minutes walking to get to the old central parts of Lisbon such as Alfama. The staff we interacted with at the breakfast area and front desk were generally quite friendly and helpful.

We stayed almost a week in YES hostel in lisbon.Great location. Great and cheap dinner including free drinks for 2 hours.Amazing staff including helpful louis, fabio and funny gonzalo.I have been travelling around the world in many hostels and i can say this one was the best expirience for me. Highly reccomended if you want to have fun time in lisbon and meet great people.

Stayed here with two other buddies for 2 nights and had a good experience. Rooms and hostel was clean, staff was fun and polite, etc. group dinners for open bar and cheap are a great way to meet people and pregame for cheap. The pub crawl that goes through their hostel isn't great, way too many people for small bars, just head out to Bario Alto yourself. But overall a very good hostel, would definitely recommend.

We really enjoyed our two week stay at Pestana Bahia Praia hotel. The staff were so friendly and helpful- especially Carla who cooked our pancakes end eggs every morning! We particularly enjoyed the location of the hotel- it‚Äôs a stunning spot with good access to the beach. I would definitely encourage renting a car as Ponta Delgada is around 25 mins away. We loved our drives around the island- it‚Äôs absolutely stunning.We really enjoyed sitting by the pool and frequenting the pool bar!This is our second full day at home and we‚Äôre missing being at Pestana Bahia!

Probabily de best place to rest a few days in Douro. Surrounded by Vineyards, peaceful but at the same time with lot of activities to do. The pool is great, the staff wonderful. Dinner is a delicious experience. Don't forget to pet the enormous dog called Touriga

The hotel was perfectly comfortable and staff were friendly. It is definitely good value. However there is no wifi available in the bedrooms which I consider unacceptable and some of the templar themes are very tacky (lit up neon templar cross outside the hotel for example). Fully fit for purpose though.

hotel_name: ibis Styles Lisboa Centro Liberdade NE
text: The staff and all the structure at this hotel is really good. The staff is friendly and the room is really comfortable. Plus, the breakfast was really well done. The place is really close to the subway, so you can go to every place using this transportation. I really recommend this hotel.

This hotel is located on the side of the river that is away from the historic part.The hotel has all modern amenities... except that it lacks enough wall sockets and has no USB charging ports. For a modern, new hotel, I expected better ways to charge devices.The hotel rooms are spacious, and the corridiors are so wide. It almost seems like a waste of space. Overall, the layout of the room could have been much better given the copious space.The lighting is very dull, and decor is dark.Breakkfast selection was typical of Hilton, but the staff seemed a little aloofOne tip is to take the finicular to the bridge and easily walk on the bridge to cross the river. Starts at 10 am. This is much better than calling an Uber. The drive is quite winding and long to the historic center.

The rooms (superior) were very clean and well maintained at first glance. But then we found that the windows were not tight and there was so much mold around the genster. In the other booked room of the family members as well.

Fantastic location   Yes it‚Äôs up a hill but views are worth it.  Catia on reception is full of excellent recommendations, The rooms are very clean and cleaned spotless , we will come back again . We had a room with a terrace and could hear the sea in mornings  beautiful Obrigado

My hubby, baby (22 mths) and I truly enjoyed our stay at the Dos Templarios Hotel. The staff was very helpful. The breakfast was delicious with an excellent coffee. The bar was always open, and the seating area indoor and outdoor was  comfortable and relaxing. The room was big and spacious, the bathroom was large too with all the amenities included. I would recommend a stay in this hotel to everyone looking for relaxing and upscale stay.

We knew this hotel was a bit outside of city center, but needed parking, which most other hotels in Coimbra don't offer. Only about 4 blocks walking to shops and restaurants and easy to catch the hop on bus to the university. The hotel itself is very well maintained, rooms are well done, we had a superior room with no view, but the bed was very comfortable. Only quibble was the quality of food offered here at the buffet..dinner and breakfast both low end tour fare. Upgrading the cuisine would make this place a gem. But for a good nights sleep and safe parking, it does the job.

Wonderful, quirky pousada; spotlessly clean; excellent location; friendly, professional staff; great buffet breakfast.  Viseu is an attractive small town, safe and well-maintained, with several good restaurants and cafes.  Ideal place to spend a day or so, though probably not much longer.
